p: The rate of development was defined as 1/(time in days between appearance of the first and seventh pair of stem leaves) = 1/d. For each nutrient level, the relationship between the RD and temperature ( t) was fitted by a linear equation in which a is the intercept with the y-axis and b is the slope: RD = a + bt ( Jarošík et al. 2004 ). The LDT, i.e. base temperature, at which the RD ceases (i.e. RD = 0), was then calculated as LDT = − a/ b. The values were calculated separately for individual nutrient levels. The SET thus corresponds to 1/ b, which indicates the number of DD above the LDT. Thermal window was expressed as the difference between the LDT, and the temperature at which the maximum RD was recorded.
